revised_title: Proceedings of the Royal Society of London - June 21, 1894
tldr: The Royal Society of London held its 63rd meeting in 1893, with the Hon. Sir C. A. Elliott delivering the annual address. The proceedings include a monograph on lichens found in Britain, as well as observations and reports on various topics, including an occultation of a Virginis observed at Dunsink in 1894.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > Scientific Meetings
